one_sentence_summary: This gene shows strong time-dependent upregulation during conidia germination in Neurospora crassa, with expression increasing dramatically from early timepoints (~5-8 TPM) to late stages (62-121 TPM), and consistently higher expression levels on maple sap medium compared to Bird medium.
notes: Clear temporal progression with >15-fold increase in expression from early to late germination stages; maple sap medium consistently shows higher expression than Bird medium, particularly at later timepoints; antisense expression is negligible throughout, confirming sense-strand specificity
experiment_name: Gene expression during conidia germination in Neurospora crassa on different media

one_sentence_summary: This gene is substantially upregulated in all mutant strains (delta sah-2, Mclr-2, and Mclr-2 delta sah-2) compared to wild type in Neurospora crassa, with delta sah-2 showing the highest expression levels (3.4-fold increase).
notes: The gene shows consistently high percentile rankings (95-97th percentile) in all mutant strains, indicating strong upregulation. Antisense expression is minimal across all conditions, confirming specificity of sense strand regulation.
experiment_name: The role of the SREBP pathway in the secretion of lignocellulolytic enzymes

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression (231-629 TPM) during sexual development in Neurospora crassa, with peak expression at 3 days post-fertilization and dramatically elevated levels in the stc-1 mutant, while maintaining much lower antisense expression across all conditions.
notes: The gene shows particularly striking upregulation in the stc-1 mutant (627 TPM vs 353 TPM in wild-type) and reduced expression in sad-1 mutant, suggesting involvement in pathways regulated by these developmental genes. High percentile rankings (92-98th percentile) indicate this is among the most highly expressed genes in the transcriptome.
experiment_name: Transcriptomes during vegetative and sexual development stage

one_sentence_summary: This gene exhibits high expression levels (200-340 TPM) during early sexual development and at 120 hours post-crossing in Neurospora crassa, with dramatic downregulation at 24, 96, and 144 hours, showing a complex temporal pattern during perithecial development.
notes: Expression shows consistent patterns between MTP and N6 priming methods, with percentile rankings consistently >94%, indicating this gene is among the most highly expressed genes in the transcriptome during most developmental stages.
experiment_name: Genome-wide transcriptome during sexual development

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows strong upregulation in response to maltose and amylose carbon sources in wild-type Neurospora crassa, with expression levels approximately doubling compared to no-carbon and sucrose controls, while the col-26 deletion strain exhibits maintained high expression on maltose but severely reduced expression on amylose.
notes: The col-26 deletion specifically disrupts amylose-induced expression while maintaining maltose responsiveness, suggesting this gene may be involved in starch degradation pathways with col-26 playing a regulatory role in amylose utilization.
experiment_name: Transcriptome analysis of the col-26 mutant and its wild type parental strain

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently higher expression in wild-type N. crassa compared to the delta mus-52 mutant strain under both low and high phosphate conditions, with approximately 2.5-fold higher transcript levels in the wild-type strain.
notes: The gene maintains high expression levels (>220 TPM) in wild-type under both phosphate conditions but shows reduced expression (~90-100 TPM) in the mutant strain, suggesting potential involvement in mus-52-regulated pathways rather than direct phosphate response.
experiment_name: Comparative transcriptome of Neurospora crassa WT and delta mus52 strains

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows strong upregulation during conidia germination in Neurospora crassa, with expression increasing approximately 3-9 fold from fresh conidia to later developmental stages, and consistently higher expression on Bird medium compared to PDA medium.
notes: Clear developmental upregulation pattern with media-specific differences; antisense expression remains consistently low throughout, indicating specific sense-strand regulation; high percentile rankings (75-91%) suggest this gene is among the most highly expressed during germination
experiment_name: Gene expression during conidia germination on PDA and Bird media

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows highest expression during asexual development (15A CON) compared to vegetative growth stages, with the Δve-1 mutant displaying elevated expression levels relative to wild-type in Neurospora crassa, particularly under conidiation conditions.
notes: Expression is consistently higher during conidiation (15A CON: 362-554 TPM) versus vegetative stages (VEG/MYC: 184-229 TPM). The Δve-1 mutant shows enhanced expression compared to wild-type, suggesting negative regulation by VE-1. Antisense transcript levels are very low across all conditions.
experiment_name: Transcriptional regulation by the Velvet complex during asexual development in Neurospora crassa

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows upregulated expression in the dim-5 deletion mutant (117.29 TPM) compared to wild-type (75.09 TPM), with intermediate expression levels in set-7 and double mutant strains, suggesting it is negatively regulated by DIM-5-mediated H3K9me3 chromatin modification in Neurospora crassa.
notes: The gene shows consistent sense strand expression across all conditions with very low antisense expression, and the upregulation in dim-5 mutant suggests it may normally be silenced by heterochromatin formation.
experiment_name: Transcriptome changes in response to genotoxic stress

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows moderate developmental regulation in Neurospora crassa, with upregulation during late development (96hr vs 36hr) in the Mat-A mating type but minimal mating type-specific differences at any time point.
notes: The most notable expression change is a 1.56-fold increase from 36hr to 96hr in Mat-A strain (log2 = 0.64), while Mat-a shows minimal temporal changes. Mating type comparisons at each time point show very small differences (log2 values -0.1 to 0.03), indicating this gene is not strongly mating type-specific.
experiment_name: Sex-specific gene expression during asexual development under constant light condition

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows moderate upregulation in the Δpp-1 mutant (138.09 TPM vs 87.44 TPM in wild-type) and slight downregulation in the Δadv-1 mutant (71.07 TPM) in Neurospora crassa germlings, with minimal antisense expression across all conditions.
notes: The gene shows consistent sense strand expression with low standard errors, suggesting reliable differential expression. Antisense expression is minimal (~0.6-0.9 TPM) across all conditions. The ~1.6-fold upregulation in Δpp-1 and ~0.8-fold expression in Δadv-1 relative to wild-type suggests this gene may be regulated by the PP-1 and ADV-1 transcription factors.
experiment_name: Gene expression analysis of ADV-1 and PP-1 mutants

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows moderate upregulation in response to light exposure in Neurospora crassa, with peak expression at 120 minutes (223 TPM) compared to dark conditions (133 TPM), followed by a decline at 240 minutes.
notes: Expression shows a biphasic response with early sustained upregulation (15-120 min) followed by decline at 240 min, suggesting possible negative feedback or circadian regulation. All samples show high percentile rankings (92-95th) indicating this is a highly expressed gene overall.
experiment_name: Characterization of light regulated genes

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all carbon sources tested in Neurospora crassa, with the highest expression on amylose (215 TPM) and amylopectin (150 TPM), and relatively lower but still substantial expression on pectin-related substrates (43-62 TPM).
notes: The gene maintains high basal expression (~60-120 TPM) across most conditions including no-carbon controls, suggesting constitutive expression with modest upregulation on starch-related substrates. Antisense expression is consistently very low (<2 TPM), indicating good strand specificity.
experiment_name: Transcriptome of N. crassa strains grown on different carbon sources (complex polysaccharides)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all conditions tested in Neurospora crassa, with transcript abundance ranging from 152-192 TPM and percentile rankings above 91st percentile, indicating minimal differential regulation between wild-type, xlr-1 deletion, and xlr-1 mutant strains grown on different carbon sources.
notes: Expression levels are consistently high across all conditions with relatively small fold changes (1.3-fold range), suggesting this gene may be constitutively expressed rather than specifically regulated by XLR-1 or carbon source availability.
experiment_name: Transcriptomic investigation of CLR-1, CLR-2, and XLR-1 roles in plant cell wall degradation

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all 48 wild Neurospora crassa isolates with TPM values ranging from 107-213, ranking in the 88th-94th percentiles, indicating constitutive expression with moderate strain-to-strain variation but no clear differential regulation pattern.
notes: This appears to be a housekeeping or constitutively expressed gene with natural population-level variation rather than experimental differential expression; the experiment was designed for SNP identification rather than differential expression analysis.
experiment_name: Population genomics transcriptomes

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all conditions in Neurospora crassa, with the highest levels in the delta-clr-2 mutant on Avicel (202.6 TPM) and modest variation between wild-type on different carbon sources (152-183 TPM).
notes: Gene shows constitutively high expression (>90th percentile in all conditions) with limited fold-change differences, suggesting it may be a housekeeping gene or constitutively expressed factor rather than a cellulose-responsive gene.
experiment_name: Transcriptional profiles induced by exposure to crystalline cellulose

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all conditions in Neurospora crassa, with the highest levels on cellobiose (227.6 TPM) and relatively modest variation between carbon sources (134.6-227.6 TPM), indicating constitutive rather than condition-specific regulation.
notes: All expression values are relatively high (>130 TPM) with percentiles in the 91-95th range, suggesting this is a moderately abundant transcript that is not strongly regulated by carbon source availability or the TBGK deletion.
experiment_name: Transcriptional profiles of WT and NCU04952, NCU00130, NCU08755 deletion mutant induced by exposure to Avicel

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all tested carbon sources in Neurospora crassa, with modest variation ranging from 202-264 TPM and slightly elevated expression on soybean straw compared to other crop residues and sucrose.
notes: The gene maintains high expression (93rd-95th percentile) across all conditions with relatively small fold-changes, suggesting constitutive importance rather than condition-specific regulation.
experiment_name: Transcriptional responses to various plant straws

one_sentence_summary: This gene exhibits moderate expression levels (27-69 TPM) in both wild-type and delta MSN1 strains of Neurospora crassa across the 22-hour dark period, with some fluctuation over time but no clear circadian rhythmicity or consistent differential expression between strains.
notes: Antisense expression is very low (<2 TPM) throughout the time course. Expression appears somewhat variable but lacks clear periodicity that would be expected for a circadian-regulated gene. The MSN1 knockout shows similar overall expression patterns to wild-type, suggesting this gene may not be strongly regulated by the MSN1 pathway.
experiment_name: RNA-sequencing of WT and delta MSN1 strains of N. crassa over a circadian time course

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression (164-248 TPM) in the sense orientation across all conditions in Neurospora crassa, with slightly elevated expression in the ve-1 mutant compared to wild-type, but no substantial response to iron starvation.
notes: Gene shows high baseline expression (94-95th percentile) with minimal condition-dependent variation; antisense expression is very low (<1 TPM) indicating proper sense-strand transcription
experiment_name: Transcriptome under standard minimal and iron strarvation conditions

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression (45-131 TPM) across all carbon sources and the no-carbon control in Neurospora crassa, with Wing nut biomass inducing the highest expression levels but no dramatic differential regulation between conditions.
notes: Gene shows constitutively high expression with modest variation across conditions. Antisense expression is consistently low across all samples. Some knockout strains show reduced expression compared to wild-type, suggesting possible regulatory feedback.
experiment_name: Transcriptomes of strains grown on different carbon sources (plant biomass)

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all carbon sources tested in Neurospora crassa, with the highest expression on trehalose (~174 TPM) and cellobiose (~149 TPM), and lowest expression on mannose (~70-87 TPM), indicating constitutive expression with moderate carbon source-dependent variation.
notes: Expression remains relatively stable (70-174 TPM range) across diverse carbon sources with antisense expression being very low (<1.5 TPM), suggesting this is likely a housekeeping gene with some metabolic responsiveness rather than a carbon source-specific regulatory gene.
experiment_name: Transcriptomes of strains grown on different carbon sources (mono-, di- and polysaccharides)

one_sentence_summary: This gene exhibits consistent high-level expression throughout the 48-hour circadian time course in Neurospora crassa, maintaining relatively stable transcript abundance (ranging from ~65-198 TPM) without clear circadian oscillations, ranking in the 90th+ percentile across most timepoints.
notes: The gene shows constitutively high expression without obvious circadian rhythmicity, suggesting it may encode a housekeeping function rather than a clock-controlled gene. Antisense expression is present but much lower than sense expression.
experiment_name: Analysis of clock-regulated genes

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows moderate expression levels (91-194 TPM) across all conditions in Neurospora crassa, with the highest expression observed in carbon starvation (no carbon 4h: 183 TPM) and clr-1 mutant on cellulose (194 TPM), but lacks clear differential regulation patterns between carbon sources or mutant strains.
notes: Expression levels are relatively stable across conditions with modest variation (91-194 TPM range). The gene appears constitutively expressed rather than showing strong carbon source-dependent regulation, though percentile rankings (85-94th) suggest moderate to high expression relative to the transcriptome.
experiment_name: Profiling of transcriptional response of clr-1 and clr-2 mutants to cellulose

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression across all plant cell wall polysaccharide substrates tested in Neurospora crassa, with TPM values ranging from 183-224 and ranking in the 92nd-94th percentiles, indicating minimal differential expression between growth conditions.
notes: Gene maintains high baseline expression regardless of substrate type, suggesting constitutive rather than substrate-specific regulation in cell wall deconstruction pathways
experiment_name: Systems analysis of plant cell wall deconstruction by Neurospora crassa

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows consistently high expression (~125-148 TPM) in the sense orientation across all conditions in Neurospora crassa, with no substantial differential expression between wild-type and Δcys-3 mutant strains or between sulfate-replete and sulfur starvation conditions.
notes: Gene expression is constitutively high (>90th percentile) regardless of sulfur availability or CYS-3 function, suggesting it may encode a housekeeping gene or essential cellular component not regulated by sulfur starvation pathways.
experiment_name: Transcriptional Profiling of sulfur starvation response

one_sentence_summary: This gene shows no substantial differential expression between the cpsf5/cpsf6 double knockout mutant and wild-type control in Neurospora crassa, with sense-strand transcript levels remaining consistently high (~250-270 TPM) in both conditions.
notes: Expression levels are very high (>95th percentile) in both conditions, suggesting this is a highly expressed gene that is not substantially affected by loss of the cleavage and polyadenylation CFIm complex components. Antisense expression is negligible in both samples.
experiment_name: 3-prime enriched transcriptome in WT (FGSC2489) and cpsf5 cpsf6 knockout mutant
